creator: oyama@cpan.org
text:
A 'configure' script on Darwin, makes wrong Makefile which strip a symbol 
unconditionally. For this reason, since trouble occurs in debugging, I want you 
to repair.

When platform which performed the 'configure' script is '*-apple-darwin*', a 
setup which strip(s) compulsorily is performed as follows at the time of 
installation.
    *-apple-darwin*)
        default_layout="Darwin"
        iflags_core="${iflags_core} -S \"-S\""
        iflags_dso="${iflags_dso} -S \"-S\""
        ;;

Why does it strip clearly?
I comment out as follows and use.

% diff -C3 configure.org configure
*** configure.org       Tue May 21 21:24:59 2002
--- configure   Wed Oct 16 18:53:29 2002
***************
*** 339,345 ****
        ;;
      *-apple-darwin*)
        default_layout="Darwin"
!       iflags_core="${iflags_core} -S \"-S\""
        iflags_dso="${iflags_dso} -S \"-S\""
        ;;
      *OS/2* )
--- 339,345 ----
        ;;
      *-apple-darwin*)
        default_layout="Darwin"
! #     iflags_core="${iflags_core} -S \"-S\""
        iflags_dso="${iflags_dso} -S \"-S\""
        ;;
      *OS/2* )
